alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 9:11PM CDT until August 20 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN MUSCATINE, NORTHWESTERN LOUISA AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 911 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, especially in southwestern Muscatine and northwest Louisa counties. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus Junction, Columbus City, Crawfordsville, Cotter, Fredonia, Gladwin and Louisa County Fairgrounds. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
